intro: Hypelate oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hypelate, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Hypelate oblongifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
